{"id":397924846,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 years, 11 months","timestamp":1600535628,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"84 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/397924846/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Two Sum IV - Input is a BST","memory":"16 MB","code":"# Definition for a binary tree node.\n# class TreeNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.left = left\n#         self.right = right\nclass Solution:\n    def findTarget(self, root: TreeNode, k: int) -> bool:\n        def inorder(root: TreeNode) -> List[int]:\n            if not root: return []\n            s, ans = [], []\n            while root or s:\n                while root:\n                    s.append(root)\n                    root = root.left\n                root = s.pop()\n                ans.append(root.val)\n                root = root.right\n            return ans\n        \n        def sortedTwoSum(x: List[int], target: int) -> bool:\n            if not x: return False\n            l, r = 0, len(x) - 1\n            while l < r:\n                if x[l] + x[r] > target:\n                    r -= 1\n                elif x[l] + x[r] < target:\n                    l += 1\n                else:\n                    return True\n            return False\n        \n        return sortedTwoSum(inorder(root), k)     \n                ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"two-sum-iv-input-is-a-bst","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
